revised_title: Fossil Plants and Their Affinities: A New Type of Sphenophyllaceous Cone
tldr: The author examines a new type of Sphenophyllaceous cone from the lower coal-measures, discussing its structure and affinities to other plant classes. The cone, named Sphenophyllum fertile, has both dorsal and ventral lobes that are fertile, unlike other known forms. The author also compares the cone to other related plant genera and discusses its potential implications for plant evolution.
